q:
In Databricks, you are working on the Alert access control in the Databricks SQL Analytics. You have invoked your methods on the following REST endpoint to manage the alert permissions by using an API. Now, if you are required to set the Can Manage permission to the user bob.smith@hackerearth.com, then which of the following Bash commands must be implemented to perform this action in this scenario:

REST endpoint:

/2.0/permissions/sql/alert/


Bash commands:
1.

git -m 'REST:' https:///api/2.0/permissions/sql/alert/ -X PATCH -d '{ "access_control_list" : [ { "user_name": bob.smith@hackerearth.com", "permission_level": "CAN_MANAGE" } ] }'

2.

curl -m 'REST:' https:///api/2.0/access_controls/sql/alert/code -M user -d '{ "access_control_list" : [ { "user_name": bob.smith@hackerearth.com", "permission_level": "CAN_MANAGE" } ] }'

3.

git -m 'REST:' https:///api/2.0/access_controls/sql/alert/code -M user -d '{ "access_control_list" : [ { "user_name": bob.smith@hackerearth.com"}]}'

4.

curl -u 'token:' https:///api/2.0/permissions/sql/alert/ -X PATCH -d '{ "access_control_list" : [ { "user_name": bob.smith@hackerearth.com", "permission_level": "CAN_MANAGE" } ] }'

In Databricks, you are working on the alert tasks from the Databricks SQL Analytics. You are creating your alert. After searching for a target query that is published, you are configuring the Trigger when field. Now, which of the following properties can be checked in order to configure this field in this scenario:

Properties

  1. Value column
  2. Condition
  3. Template
  4. Threshold

In Databricks, you are working on SQL Analytics. If you are required to implement the alerts on multiple columns such as emp_added_count and emp_removed_count from a table named data, then which of the following SQL queries can be used to perform this action in this scenario:
Queries
1.

SELECT CASE WHEN emp_added_count > 100 AND emp_removed_count > 15 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END
FROM (
SELECT sum(CASE WHEN is_added THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS emp_added_count,
sum(CASE WHEN is_removed THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS emp_removed_count
FROM employee_table) data

2.

SELECT CASE WHEN emp_added_count > 100 AND emp_removed_count > 15 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END
FROM (
SELECT sum(CASE WHEN is_added THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS emp_added_count,
sum(is_remove) AS emp_removed_count
FROM employee_table) data

3.

SELECT CASE WHEN emp_added_count > 100 AND emp_removed_count > 15 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END
FROM (
SELECT sum(CASE WHEN is_added THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS emp_added_count,
sum(is_remove) AS emp_removed_count

4.

SELECT CASE WHEN emp_added_count > 100 AND emp_removed_count > 15 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END
FROM (
SELECT sum(is_added) AS emp_added_count,
sum(is_remove) AS emp_removed_count
from employee
